name: thedailybeast
text: NEW: In September 2018, an obscure Hollywood talent agent reached out to a reporter at the National Enquirer with a hell of a story. Michael Sanchez said that one of the world’s wealthiest people had accidentally sent nudes of himself to a colleague. https://t.co/VvN1eWAFKW

name: thedailybeast
text: Less than four months later, the Enquirer ran a multi-part series exposing Amazon founder Jeff Bezos’s extramarital affair. But Sanchez has disputed public accounts of his involvement since then and has filed lawsuits against Bezos and AMI. https://t.co/7rI5Hgvzj7

name: thedailybeast
text:
AMI moved to dismiss its lawsuit and sanction Sanchez for allegedly abusing the court system.

As part of that motion, AMI revealed new information about how the Bezos expose came together—and about Sanchez’s role in leaking information to the tabloid. https://t.co/7rI5Hgvzj7

name: thedailybeast
text: Those documents tell AMI’s side of the story and Sanchez’s desire to sell the salacious tale. However, they also reveal inconsistencies in what AMI employees told each other, what Sanchez told them, what appeared in print, and what AMI has said publicly. https://t.co/7rI5Hgvzj7

name: thedailybeast
text: Read the full story by @lachlan here: https://t.co/7rI5Hgvzj7
